title: Edwardian Era Elegance
description: S-shaped corsets, high collars, and lavish gowns emphasized a formal, feminine silhouette at the turn of the century.

title: Poiret & the Birth of Modernism
description: Paul Poiret popularized corset-free, fluid silhouettes with bold colors and Orientalist influences.
imageURL: Poiret and the Birth of Modernism.jpg

title: The Flapper Revolution
description: Drop waists, short hemlines, beading, and bobbed hair reflected women’s liberation and nightlife culture.

title: Hollywood Glamour
description: Bias-cut satin gowns and long, sleek lines were inspired by silver-screen icons.

title: Dior’s New Look
description: Christian Dior reintroduced opulence post-WWII with cinched waists, full skirts, and soft shoulders.

title: Mod & the Miniskirt
description: Mary Quant and London’s youthquake brought bold geometrics, bright colors, and the iconic miniskirt.

title: Punk Style Emerges
description: DIY aesthetics, ripped tees, leather, and safety pins — popularized by Vivienne Westwood and subculture scenes.

title: Grunge Fashion
description: Flannel shirts, distressed denim, and combat boots challenged luxury norms in the early ’90s.
